person.persName: Richard Wigginton Thompson (Vigo County, Indiana, attorney, state congressman & U.S. rep)

body.p: Vigo County, Indiana, attorney and politician. Culpeper, Virginia, native. Son of William Mills Thompson and Catherine Wigginton Broadus Thompson. Married to Harriet Eliza Gardner Thompson in Ohio on May 5, 1836. Father of Mary Thompson, Frederick Thompson, Richard Thompson, Charles Thompson, Harry Thompson, and Jennie Thompson. Store-keeper’s clerk in Louisville, Kentucky c1831. Admitted to the bar in 1834. Practiced law in Bedford, Indiana. Member of the Indiana House of Representatives from 1834 to 1836. Member of the Senate of the State of Indiana from 1836 to 1838. President pro tempore of the state senate and acting lieutenant governor of Indiana. Presidential elector in 1840 and 1864. Elected as a Whig to the United States House of Representatives from 1841 to 1843 and from 1847 to 1849. Attorney in Terre Haute in 1860.
